Current Components Table Table - column to card

Table - column to card

Description

This implementation splits the table on cards based on the columns of the table. The title of each card will remain the <th>. data-td-label should be set to be the same as the content of the first column to ensure that the title of the card and rows are the same across all screen widths. On small screens we want to hide the column header, so we need to add data-table-hide on the first <td> or <th> from each <tr>.

Usage example

<div class="table table--vertical">
  <table class="table__content">
    <thead class="table__head">
      <tr class="table__row table__row--head">
        <th class="table__cell table__cell--head" data-table-hide></th>
        <th class="table__cell table__cell--head">Col 1</th>
        <th class="table__cell table__cell--head">Col 2</th>
        <th class="table__cell table__cell--head">Col 3</th>
        <th class="table__cell table__cell--head">Col 4</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody class="table__body">
      <tr class="table__row">
        <td class="table__cell" data-table-hide>Row 1</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 1">Value 1/1</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 1">Value 1/2</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 1">Value 1/3</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 1">Value 1/4</td>
      </tr>

      <tr class="table__row">
        <td class="table__cell" data-table-hide>Row 2</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 2">Value 2/1</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 2">Value 2/2</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 2">Value 2/3</td>
        <td class="table__cell" data-td-label="Row 2">Value 2/4</td>
      </tr>
    </tbody>
  </table>
</div>
Col 1 Col 2 Col 3 Col 4
Row 1 Value 1/1 Value 1/2 Value 1/3 Value 1/4
Row 2 Value 2/1 Value 2/2 Value 2/3 Value 2/4
